results.title: Roslyn and Blagica: everybody needs a friend
results.creator_credit: Richard Mordaunt, James Ricketson, Jan Sharp and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Discussion highlights a young Yugoslav girl’s desire to become Australian in order to gain acceptance and combat prejudice. By contrast, her Australian friend endorses the continuance of ethnic identity and customs and extols the virtues of a multicultural society.

results.title: Rooftopics
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Views of Sydney Harbour, city and inner suburbs from the roof-tops of various buildings. Shows scenes of everyday activities, roof gardens, play-grounds, swimming pools, street traffic, etc. viewed from above. Includes humorous animated sequence involving a man, his towel and a woman beside a swimming pool. No spoken commentary. Edited by Wayne Le Clos; photographed by George Alexander; music by Eric Gross and script by Antonio Colacino.

results.title: Robert Klippel. 3. Junk Sculpture, 1963
results.creator_credit: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films
results.brief_description: Incorporating music and light, this film explores a sculpture by artist Robert Klippel. Made of machinery and sheet metal, the various plays on angle and light take the viewer inside the artwork and allow a range of perspectives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Corinne Cantrill, Arthur Cantrill and Firebird Films

results.title: Roads at work
results.creator_credit: John Milson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Transport in Australia”.
The importance of roads in Australia as a chief means of communication and a basis of the entire transport system. Shows their early haphazard growth from bullock wagon tracks, and the highly specialised work involved in organising major roadworks, and traffic today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Milson, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Road to the West
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: The story of the early days of Sydney Cove told by means of historical stills and by the re-enactment of the crossing of the Blue Mountains by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson, the resulting development and relics of that period, including the old Court House at Hartley. Today fast transport enables commuters to travel to and from Sydney and the Blue Mountains in less than two hours, passing through towns named after the three explorers.

results.title: Richard Takes a Train Ride
results.creator_credit: Stanley Hawes, Joan Boundy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A junior school film in the Social Studies series. Describes events on a rail trip from Murray Bridge, on the Victoria-South Australian border to Adelaide; purchase of tickets; work of porters; views of countryside en route; work of the conductor; tunnels; and finally, arrival at Adelaide.

results.title: Reaching for the stars
results.creator_credit: Loch Townsend, John Martin-Jones, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Shows Australian research in astronomy. Visits the observatory at Mount Stromolo, which houses big telescopes, cameras to map the skies, and the National Time Service. Goes on to show research on radio astronomy at the Radiophysics Laboratory (CSIRO), Sydney, and using Mills cross of stationary aerials and other devices. Pictures the windmill aerials at Dapto, used for tracking the sun

results.title: The Rail way
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, Department of Transport and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at railways in Australia from Alice Springs to Kalgoorlie and Normanton. Shows trains serving the mining fields in central Queensland and the suburban trains of the big cities. Discusses problems brought about by different gauges throughout the country, and looks at the economic future of railways. Commentator Patsy Adam-Smith.

results.title: Rail town
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Joan Long and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Dramatises the activities and life of the people of Port Augusta, South Australia, with emphasis on the significance of this city as a railhead linking the Eastern States with the West and the Northern Territory.

results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Kit Denton, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Denton, Don Murray and Film Australia
